page.title: 02Barford and Wasperton cont
page.content: traders and their skills have disappeared and their dwellings have also become private houses. Barford has a very thriving village hall where the following hold regular meetings. Toddler Group. Play Group. Over Sixties Club, Drama Group, Womens Institute and Keep Fit. Scouts, Brownies and Girl Guides meet in the school. Wasperton School is now the village hall and has been temporarily taken over by the County Museum as offices to deal with the local archaelogical excavations. It has no shops or amenities of any kind. The church shares the Rectory with Barford. There is an hourly bus service to Warwick and Stratford, most residents are car owners. Tourists and business men stay at the Glebe Hotel once the Rectory.
